body_html: @shrutim90 It didn't work for me. When I use a tf.slim model with my own dataset and is_training=True I obtain a checkpoint with 97% accuracy. If I then import this checkpoint into the same tf.slim model but with is_training=False I get only around 40% accuracy.
body_text: @shrutim90 It didn't work for me. When I use a tf.slim model with my own dataset and is_training=True I obtain a checkpoint with 97% accuracy. If I then import this checkpoint into the same tf.slim model but with is_training=False I get only around 40% accuracy.
body: @shrutim90 It didn't work for me. When I use a tf.slim model with my own dataset and is_training=True I obtain a checkpoint with 97% accuracy. If I then import this checkpoint into the same tf.slim model but with is_training=False I get only around 40% accuracy.
